Related docs work done in #23678

items.content_html:
Description

I added parentheses to an example where a regex expression needed to capture the matched capital letter for use in the replacement value.
For example,
The current example returns:
str.replace(/[A-Z]/g, "z$1") // 'jz$1z$1hy'

But expects:
str.replace(/([A-Z])/g, "z$1") // 'jzQzWhy'

Motivation

To fix an error in the example code execution.

Additional details

None.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Capture match on feature detection example

items.content_html:

items.title: Add a small definition of `Block container`.

items.content_html:
Description

This adds docs for the symbol-as-weakmap-keys feature. It's implemented in V8 and Safari TP. The FF bug is here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1710433

cc @hamishwillee

Motivation

Additional details

This is pending BCD. In addition, I think we should add a note about the limited support for symbol keys at least for a few months, but I don't see a clean way to do it because it's so intertwined with the API's usage.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: New stage 4 JS feature symbols-as-weakmap-keys

items.content_html:
Description

Updating the outdated documents that deal with Storage Access API/ storage access grants. Storage is always partitioned and storage access grants are limited to access to cookies now.

Motivation

The documentation about the Storage Access API and automatic storage access grants are outdated since the implementation changed in Fx109. The outdated documentation led to confusion because developers expected to see the old behavior.

Additional details

Release notes: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/109.0/releasenotes/
Meta bug: Bug 1758737 - [meta] Always Partition Storage

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: WIP: Updating content that storage is always partitioned

items.content_html: This PR is a part of a project to format all of the documents using Prettier, and then enforce Prettier formatting for the files going forward. This PR formats the remaining files of the /web/web_components folder that have not already been touched by other PRs.
items.title: Format /web/web_components using Prettier

items.content_html:
Description

Documents the composition of the content script global.

Motivation

Content scripts in extensions behave somewhat consistently across browsers, except when they don't. This is currently not clearly documented, and occasionally confuses extension developers.

Additional details

Related bugs:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1208775 (and linked bugs)
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1288284

Examples of bugs showing confusion from extension developers:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1577400
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1681809
  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1814898

Related issues and pull requests

None
items.title: Document composition of content script global
